attributes.action: be charged with manslaughter for the death of every British soldier killed in action in Afghanistan post May 2009
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gordon Brown has rejected the advice of both the Secretary of Defence and the Chief of the General Staff to reinforce the British forces in Afghanistan. 2,000 troops had been prepared and earmarked by the MOD for Afghanistan where they are apparantly desperately needed in order to stabilise Helmand province. Gordon Brown has chosen to refuse these reinforcements on grounds of financial cost thereby endangering both the lives of British soldiers and Afghan citizens and as a result should be held criminally accountable for every British soldier killed as a result of his decision.

reasons: Language which is offensive, intemperate, or provocative
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
